arm_group.description: Receiving Targeting the Teachable Moment Intervention materials (focusing on health behaviors and issues specific to breast cancer survivors) every other week for 4 months
Receiving Standardized Lifestyle Management materials (focusing mostly on health behaviors) every other week for 4 months
Receiving SLM materials at the end of the 7 months

brief_summary.textblock:
1. The purpose of the study is to test the effectiveness of a new mail-based intervention
           for breast cancer survivors compared with standard lifestyle management and
           no-treatment.

        2. This intervention addresses both lifestyle factors such as dietary and physical
           activities and psychological issues specific to breast cancer survivors to improve
           healthy behaviors.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Lifestyle Intervention for Breast Cancer Survivors

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will be assigned randomly to one of three groups: 1) newly developed mail-based
      intervention (Targeting the Teachable Moment Intervention; TTMI), 2) standard Lifestyle
      Intervention (SLM), and 3) usual care. Both TTMI and SLM focus on health behaviors, however
      TTMI additionally addresses psychosocial issues specific to breast cancer survivors.

      All participants will complete questionnaires at the time they start the study, the end of
      the 4 months, and 3 months later for a follow-up.

      If participants are assigned to any of the intervention group, they will receive materials
      every other week for 4 months. If participants are assigned to the usual care group, they
      will receive the same materials as the standard lifestyle intervention et the end of the 7
      months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  First diagnosed with breast cancer in the past 1.5 years

          -  stage 0~2 breast cancer

          -  no prior adjuvant treatment for another cancer

          -  Can read and write English

          -  Are not participating in other health behavior research right now

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  apparent serious mental disturbance

          -  male breast cancer survivors

intervention.description: TTMI material (every other week for 4 months)
SLM material (every other week for 4 months)

clinical_study.official_title: Targeting the Teachable Moment: A Lifestyle Intervention for Breast Cancer Survivors

other_outcome.description: usefulness of each module (e.g., whether each intervention is helpful or not) will be assessed at each mailing (for eight times) for 4 months.

primary_outcome.description: Diet habits (amount of fat and fruit/vegetable uptake) will be assessed at 3 times: at baseline, at the end of the 4 months, and at the end of 7 months.
primary_outcome.measure: Changes in eating habits measured by the National Cancer Institute Quick Food Scan
primary_outcome.time_frame: Meaured at baseline, 4 months, and 7 months

primary_outcome.description: Frequency and amount of time for physical exercise will be measured at 3 times: at baseline, at the end of 4 months, and at the end of 7 months.
primary_outcome.measure: Changes in physical activity measured by the Paffenbarger physical activity questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Meaured at baseline, 4 months, and 7 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Coping strategies (e.g., problem-focused coping, emotional approach coping) will be assessed at 3 times: at baseline, at the end of the 4 months, and at the end of 7 months.
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in coping strategies measured by the Brief COPE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 4 months, and 7 months

secondary_outcome.description: A general sense of perceived self-efficacy will be measured at 3 times: at the baseline, at the end of 4 months, and at the end of 7 months
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Self-efficacy measured by the General Self-Efficacy Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 4 months, and 7 months

secondary_outcome.description: Social support will be measured at 3 times: at baseline, at the end of 4 months, and at the end of 7 months
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in social support measured by the Interpersonal Support Evaluation List (ISEL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 4 months, and 7 months

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of Meaning and Search for Meaning will be measured at 3 times: at baseline, at the end of 4 months, and at the end of 7 months.
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in life meaning measured by the Meaning in Life Questionnaire (MLQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at baseline, 4 months, and 7 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
